page.title: 01GAZETEER STOKE ON TERN
page.content: Our area is very rural.It has one major road and many small country lanes.There are two villages:Stoke on Tern and Wistanswick.One school serves two villages.There is a public bus service but most families travel by car.The land is fairly flat.On the western side the fields are mostly planted with crops.The farmers grow corn(barley and wheat),potatoes,oil seed rape,some peas and sugar beet.Towards the east the land changes.Here the fields are mainly rough grazing and common land.The field boundaries are of hedges and trees.There are many small woods and ponds dotted about.Some farmers keep livestock as well.The most important are dairy cattle,pigs,and beef cattle, with some sheep. Poultry farming is very common.Eggs are a big part of our diet.
